title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 September 2015 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has joined #xwiki  
00:43 <vmassol> has quit  
01:57 <Denis> has quit  
03:49 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:10 <Denis> has quit

04:26 <cpe> has joined #xwiki  
06:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:00 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki

08:35 <mflorea> has quit

09:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <Ramona3> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <Ramona1> has quit  
09:32 <tmortagne> has quit  
09:36 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <tmortagne> has quit  
09:43 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <tmortagne1> has quit  
09:47 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <Ramona3> has quit  
10:17 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:17 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <vmassol1> good morning everyone  
10:19 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
10:19 <vmassol> so we have 4 user stories remaining on http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NestedSpaces for RC1  
10:19 <vmassol> gdelhumeau is on PE4 AFAIK  
10:20 <vmassol> s/PE4/PE3  
10:20 <vmassol> for BA1 we should all help out since it's about making all bundled extensions work with Nested Spaces  
10:20 <vmassol> and we have some jira issues opened for that  
10:20 <gdelhumeau> I think PE3 is OK on the snapshot  
10:20 <vmassol> ah cool, I'll test it  
10:24 <vmassol> then we have PF1  
10:26 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <evalica> has quit  
10:33 <vmassol> btw we still have some getSpaces() calls (appears in the console) which probably means non scalable code  
10:33 <vmassol> maybe the jira issues that are open will fix it, if not we should open new issues  
10:34 <vmassol> could be http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12325#  
10:35 <vmassol> i don't know if there are other places still use getSpaces(), checking quicky  
10:36 <vmassol> - Spaces macro but that's ok  
10:36 <vmassol> - xmlrpc  
10:37 <vmassol> - webdav  
10:39 <vmassol> - DatabaseSearch.xml  
10:39 <vmassol> for the dashbpard once we remove the usage of the spaces macro it'll go away :)  
11:09 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
12:04 <Trefex> has quit  
12:04 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
12:19 <woshilapin> has quit  
12:33 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
12:36 <silverdrop> has quit  
12:36 <vrachieru> has quit  
13:06 <vmassol> Enygma`: do we still need http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12432# ?  
13:06 <vmassol> I don't remember what you did in the end  
13:06 <Denis> has quit  
13:10 <vmassol> scheduling for after 7.2 (let me know if it's more urgent than that)  
13:12 <martinus\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <martinus\_\_> hi vmassol  
13:12 <martinus\_\_> thanks for the answer in http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12037  
13:12 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: Hi Martin. Does it work? :)  
13:12 <vmassol> (haven't tested)  
13:12 <martinus\_\_> I just checked the XWikiServerClass objects  
13:13 <martinus\_\_> There are 4 of them , the first has a pretty name  
13:13 <martinus\_\_> it is the main one  
13:13 <martinus\_\_> the 3 remaining pretty name is emptyu  
13:14 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, wdyt ?  
13:16 <vmassol> I guess one solution would be to modify WikisLiveTableResultsMacros  
13:16 <vmassol> this is the page that generates the JSON for the wiki index LT  
13:17 <vmassol> so one workaround would to be to write a few lines in there to remove the duplication  
13:17 <martinus\_\_> in our case the aliases were added from the UI  
13:17 <vmassol> or add back the uniquefilter at line https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wiki/xwiki-platform-wiki-ui/xwiki-platform-wiki-ui-mainwiki/src/main/resources/WikiManager/WikisLiveTableResultsMacros.xml#L188  
13:18 <vmassol> (not sure what other effect it may have)  
13:18 <vmassol> addFilter('unique')  
13:18 <martinus\_\_> hmm hmm  
13:19 <martinus\_\_> this issue doesn't make my life very easy :)  
13:19 <vmassol> just try .addFilter("unique") for now  
13:19 <martinus\_\_> in WikisLiveTableResultsMacros ?  
13:20 <martinus\_\_> ok  
13:21 <vmassol> I don't know if it'll work but I don't have much time now to go deeper on this issue  
13:21 <martinus\_\_> that's not blocking and/or dangerous, we can wait for the next update :)  
13:21 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:22 <vmassol> unfortunately right now we're focusing on Nested Spaces for 7.2 so it probably won't be fixed before 7.3 or 7.4 et earliest  
13:22 <vmassol> unless someone work on it...  
13:22 <vmassol> or provides a patch/pr  
13:24 <martinus\_\_> I see. Maybe XWIKI SAS will provide the fix as we have a contract support ;)  
13:25 <vmassol> yes maybe you should see with them! :)  
13:25 <martinus\_\_> already done. waiting for an answer but I like to log the info myself too  
13:30 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I've tested the Page Admin and found a bug  
13:30 <vmassol> ah no, it' just that you've done it differently…  
13:31 <vmassol> I'll comment on the issue  
13:37 <vmassol> Enygma`: ping  
13:37 <martinus\_\_> has quit  
13:38 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <vmassol> Enygma`: when you're back, I think there's a problem when you're on Main/WebHome and click + to create a page. By default it doesn't create a child page (ie the new page is not inside the Main space). Should I open a jira?  
13:48 <Trefex> has quit  
13:58 <Enygma`> vmassol:  http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12432 is still valid  
13:58 <Enygma`> will probably apply the string serialization comparison  
13:59 <Enygma`> at the time I did it for watchlist and then we agreed that it would be a nice to do that for EntityReference in general  
13:59 <Enygma`> it just has to be done  
13:59 <Enygma`> re the create action on the homepage, that is intentional  
14:00 <Enygma`> the logic that I applied there was to try to avoid regular users from creating most of the pages as children of the "Main" space, when, in fact, their intent was to create a top level document  
14:00 <Enygma`> if they really want to create a child of the homepage's space, then they can do so using the tree picker or the location edit  
14:01 <vmassol> hmm  
14:02 <Enygma`> also see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12496 related to top level document creation, since the tree picker does not currently support selecting the root (wiki)  
14:02 <vmassol> I don't understand the logic  
14:02 <Enygma`> when a regular user lands on the homepage and hits create to create a document, his intent is not to create a document under the homepage's space, but as top level document  
14:02 <vmassol> what is the problem wsith creating child documents of Main?  
14:02 <vmassol> why do you say so?  
14:02 <vmassol> are you sure?  
14:02 <Enygma`> because the homepage is already present in the breadcrumbs  
14:03 <Enygma`> you don`t need to create children of "Main" to have the homepage in the breadcrumbs  
14:03 <vmassol> it's not the home page  
14:03 <vmassol> it's the home of the wiki  
14:03 <vmassol> we talked about this  
14:03 <Enygma`> if you do, you`ll have the homepage twice  
14:03 <Enygma`> for all your pages  
14:03 <vmassol> again we talked about this  
14:03 <vmassol> there 's a jira issue for that one  
14:04 <vmassol> you don't have homrpage twice, you have Wiki home + Main space  
14:04 <Enygma`> why do you want to create all the pages as children of the "Main" space?  
14:04 <Enygma`> the Main space has no meaning now  
14:04 <Enygma`> it's just a holder for the homepage  
14:04 <vmassol> it's the space we reserved for users to create content in by default  
14:04 <vmassol> and I don't understand the special "if"  
14:04 <Enygma`> I don`t agree  
14:05 <vmassol> I don't see why it would be handled diffrentely than, say, the Sandbox space  
14:05 <Enygma`> we are now creating top level documents  
14:05 <vmassol> what?  
14:05 <vmassol> no of coruse not  
14:05 <vmassol> we want to createc hildren documents  
14:05 <vmassol> that's hy we introduced nested docs!  
14:05 <vmassol> :)  
14:05 <vmassol> we don't want just top level docs  
14:05 <Enygma`> do you want all your urls to be /xwiki/bin/view/Main/something/something/something?  
14:06 <Enygma`> that`s not what I said  
14:07 <vmassol> ok so we need to find a better solution  
14:07 <vmassol> what we are saying in essence  
14:07 <vmassol> is that we're missing a page that materialize the home of the wiki  
14:08 <Enygma`> I don`t follow  
14:08 <vmassol> right now  
14:08 <vmassol> when you're on Main.WebHome  
14:08 <vmassol> you can be either:  
14:08 <vmassol> - on the wiki home page  
14:08 <vmassol> - on the Main space home page  
14:08 <vmassol> depending on how you view it  
14:08 <vmassol> (and wiki home page can point to another page btw)  
14:08 <vmassol> (doesn't have to point to Main.WebHome)  
14:09 <Enygma`> yes, told you I did not write the "if" with "Main.WebHome"  
14:10 <Enygma`> I had in mind the user's default and "next>next>next" behavior  
14:10 <Enygma`> you land on the wiki, you create a page  
14:10 <Enygma`> why did you just create Main.MyPage ?  
14:10 <Enygma`> instead of MyPage(.WebHome)?  
14:10 <vmassol> so if wiki home points to MySpace.MyPage and you're on Main.WebHome and you hit +  
14:11 <vmassol> is it expected that you want to create a top level page? not obvious to me  
14:11 <Enygma`> you`re not applying the same logic  
14:11 <vmassol> so the test is on the wiki home ?  
14:11 <vmassol> (instead of Main.WebHome)  
14:11 <Enygma`> "if wiki home points to MySpace.MyPage and you're on Main.WebHome and you hit +" => you create a child of Main.WebHome... because you landed on Main.WebHome intentionally, since it is not the wiki`s homepage  
14:12 <Enygma`> "(03:09:44 PM) Enygma`: yes, told you I did not write the "if" with "Main.WebHome" "  
14:12 <Enygma`> yes  
14:12 <vmassol> ok so in tthe example I gacve  
14:12 <vmassol> \*gave  
14:12 <vmassol> if I'm on Main.WebHome and I hit + it'll create a children because Main.Webome != wiki home  
14:12 <vmassol> correct?  
14:13 <vmassol> testing :)  
14:13 <Enygma`> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/locationPicker\_macros.vm#L115  
14:14 <vmassol> BTW seems the XWiki icon in top left is not obeying the wiki home  
14:14 <Enygma`> I know  
14:14 <Enygma`> I believe there is an issue  
14:14 <vmassol> nor is the redirect  
14:15 <vmassol> (root webapp redirect)  
14:15 <vmassol> indeed works fine, cool! Thanks for the explanations  
14:15 <Enygma`> sure  
14:15 <vmassol> I just tried xwiki as a user and was surprised why my page was top level  
14:16 <vmassol> I understand now  
14:16 <Enygma`> yes, well, I really believe it makes more sense this way  
14:16 <vmassol> we'll see if any user complains  
14:16 <Enygma`> of course :)  
14:16 <vmassol> creating issue for the home icon + root webapp redriect  
14:16 <vmassol> unless you know of existin issues?  
14:17 <vmassol> oh you said there was one  
14:17 <vmassol> checking  
14:17 <Enygma`> think this was it http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11767  
14:17 <Enygma`> it`s a continuation of the wiki descriptor editing made available in administration  
14:17 <vmassol> "Be able to change the home page of a wiki by editing its descriptor" this part is done  
14:18 <Enygma`> right  
14:18 <Enygma`> it's actually the second part that is left  
14:18 <vmassol> yes and it's a bit generic  
14:18 <Enygma`> the issue`s description mentions the logo  
14:18 <vmassol> are you ok if I retitle it just as an issue with the logo?  
14:19 <vmassol> and we can open other issues for other parts if need be  
14:19 <vmassol> ?  
14:19 <Enygma`> sergiu fixed some other places in the past as I can see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8906  
14:20 <Enygma`> I guess we could  
14:20 <Enygma`> go ahead  
14:20 <vmassol> ok thanks  
14:24 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:39 <vmassol> Enygma`: hmm going to be harder to do for the root webapp  
14:39 <vmassol> since it doesn't have access to the wiki  descirptors… ;)  
14:42 <Enygma`> vmassol: wdym?  
14:43 <vmassol> Enygma`: Imean that it would be nice that http://localhost would redirect to the wiki home page  
14:43 <vmassol> however http://localhost/xwiki/ shoukd work too, this one is easy, creating an isseu for it  
14:44 <Enygma`> oh, I see  
14:44 <vmassol> created XWIKI-12499  
14:45 <vmassol> but for the root redirect not much we can do...  
14:45 <vmassol> actually we can  
14:45 <vmassol> I'll create a jira issue too  
14:45 <Enygma`> worst case, we write the main wiki's homepage in some file on the filesystem for the initialization to read  
14:45 <Enygma`> or something like that  
14:45 <vmassol> there's an easier way :)  
14:45 <vmassol> creating issue  
14:46 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <vmassol> no need :)  
14:48 <vmassol> it redirect to the /xwiki  
14:48 <vmassol> :)  
14:48 <vmassol> so http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12499 is enough  
14:50 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <vmassol> guys  
15:01 <vmassol> I've updated http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HJavaScriptBestPractices with what I believe is our current practice  
15:01 <vmassol> please let me know if you agree  
15:01 <vmassol> especially sdumitriu  
15:01 <vmassol> :)  
15:11 <Enygma`> "Some non-core features can be made available only to browsers where  Javascript is enabled. However core XWiki features should be usable even  when Javascript is turned off."  
15:12 <Enygma`> that`s not really valid ATM  
15:13 <Enygma`> http://a11yproject.com/posts/myth-screen-readers-dont-use-javascript/  
15:14 <vmassol> can you mention why it's not valid ATM?  
15:14 <Enygma`> http://webaim.org/techniques/javascript/  
15:15 <vmassol> maybe you mean with flamingo  
15:15 <Enygma`> so users with screen readers acutally have javascript enabled and they will not see the no-javascript version we struggle to write :)  
15:16 <vmassol> Enygma`: you should really try it one day  
15:16 <vmassol> and you'll see how much we're far from having good WCAG (independently of JS)  
15:16 <Enygma`> yes, on Flamingo's latest versions we have many elements that don`t work without JS  
15:17 <tmortagne> will be easier when we get back validator...  
15:17 <vmassol> I spent a lot of time a few years ago to test WCAG for xwiki  
15:17 <Enygma`> A 2012 survey by WebAIM of screen reader users found that 98.6% of respondents had JavaScript enabled.  
15:17 <Enygma`> you are talking about content that is displayed when javascript is disabled  
15:17 <vmassol> you're talking about 2 things at once  
15:18 <Enygma`> but what I am saying is that, apparently, that no-javascript content is never executed  
15:18 <vmassol> - xwiki core working without JS  
15:18 <vmassol> - WCAG experience  
15:18 <Enygma`> and our real concern should be to improve our JS content  
15:18 <vmassol> Enygma`:  no js is not for WCAG  
15:19 <vmassol> (not just)  
15:19 <vmassol> anyway my point here is not to discuss whether we want JS or not  
15:19 <vmassol> it's to reflect what we believe is the current status  
15:19 <vmassol> and what I remember is what I wreote  
15:19 <vmassol> am I wrong?  
15:20 <vmassol> the only agreement I thinkI heard was that core xwiki features should work when js is off but maybe I'm wrong  
15:20 <vmassol> just tell me  
15:20 <Enygma`> what I am asking is: when is JS off?  
15:20 <vmassol> when you turn it off  
15:20 <vmassol> like I've just done in my browser to test  
15:21 <Enygma`> apparently in 1.4% of users with screen readers :)  
15:21 <Enygma`> and in regular users, well...  
15:21 <vmassol> when caleb uses lynx  
15:21 <Enygma`> :)  
15:21 <vmassol> when someone uses an old phone without js  
15:21 <vmassol> I don't know  
15:21 <vmassol> it doesn't matter  
15:22 <vmassol> last time we talked driopping support for no-js browsing sergiu was -1  
15:22 <vmassol> so this didn't pass  
15:22 <Enygma`> yeah, IMO it`s another 1% of gain that takes 99% of effort  
15:22 <vmassol> and marius didn't agree either AFAIR  
15:22 <vmassol> Enygma`: if you wish to discuss this you should start a vote :)  
15:22 <Trefex> has quit  
15:23 <vmassol> as I said on the thread I'm +1 on my side so you don't need to convince me ;)  
15:23 <vmassol> ok I'll remove what I wrote and say the topic is not dieced  
15:23 <vmassol> I don't want to spend more time, already spent 20 miutes too much :)  
15:24 <Enygma`> me neither... all I said when starting this discussion is that the phrase was not currently valid :)  
15:24 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <Enygma`> you can`t reach Administration from the UI, you can`t create/copy/rename/?delete? documents and probably other issues  
15:25 <vmassol> "you can`t create/copy/rename/?delete? documents" that looks new  
15:25 <vmassol> before 7.2 you probably could  
15:26 <Enygma`> yes, because in 7.2 you had 2 text inputs  
15:26 <vmassol> yes what I remember we said  
15:26 <Enygma`> in = before  
15:26 <vmassol> is that flamingo was not working when js is off but usrers who wanted no js could use another skin :)  
15:26 <vmassol> something like that  
15:27 <Enygma`> :))))  
15:27 <Enygma`> ok then  
15:27 <vmassol> ie that if you uses direct urls you could use xwiki  
15:27 <vmassol> but even that it possibly not sure anymore  
15:27 <Enygma`> sure, URLs work AFAIK  
15:28 <vmassol> delete/copy/rename don't require JS now?  
15:28 <vmassol> (haven't tried)  
15:28 <Enygma`> the UI does  
15:28 <vmassol> the actions I mean  
15:28 <vmassol> ie you type a URL by hand  
15:29 <Enygma`> of course that works  
15:29 <Enygma`> it's a form at the end of the day  
15:29 <Enygma`> if we`re fine with that, then ok  
15:30 <sdumitriu> vmassol: OK with the JS practices, I'd even say on\* attributes should be completely forbidden, not just avoided  
15:31 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ok. I've just removed the line that was possibly not agreed on :)  
15:31 <vmassol> ie what part of xwiki should work or not when js is turned off ;)  
15:31 <vmassol> we'll need to continue that discussion on the list and decide what we want officially  
15:49 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:57 <Ramona2> has quit  
16:08 <vmassol> it would be good to have someone assigned to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12477  
16:08 <vmassol> maybe gdelhumeau?  
16:08 <gdelhumeau> I can hanle as an option of the create page  maybe  
16:09 <vmassol> evalica1: have you proposed something for importing from office?  
16:10 <evalica1> vmassol: the integration inside the create step  
16:10 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
16:11 <vmassol> k then you both agree cool :)  
16:11 <evalica> :)  
16:12 <msmeria> has quit  
16:21 <Enygma`> vmassol: for when we get the chance: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12500  
16:26 <vmassol> Enygma`: k thanks  
16:27 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
16:54 <Trefex> has quit  
17:08 <gsmeria> has left #xwiki

17:44 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:45 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:25 <vmassol> hmm  
18:26 <vmassol> does this mean some user have admin access? :)  
18:26 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:27 <vmassol> seems like this Martin Bek was able to access the EM  
18:28 <vmassol> indeed seems he was able to change XWikiPreferences: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?viewer=changes&rev2=28.1  
18:28 <vmassol> checkign permissions  
18:28 <vmassol> fixed  
18:29 <vmassol> temporarily  
18:29 <vmassol> till the next day… I need to find the energy to save a new backup of playground....

18:58 <evalica> has quit
